verbs.description: orientate (third-person singular simple present orientates, present participle orientating, simple past and past participle orientated)

entries.meaning: (UK, New Zealand, Australia, intransitive) To face a given direction.
(UK, New Zealand, Australia, reflexive) To determine one's position relative to the surroundings; to orient (oneself).
examples: He [â€¦] stood for a moment, orientating himself exactly in the light of his knowledge.

entries.meaning: To arrange in order; to dispose or place (a body) so as to show its relation to other bodies, or the relation of its parts among themselves.
examples: The one preferred is to make the dominant forms first order, that is, orientated in such a way as to intersect both horizontal crystallographic axes.

entries.meaning: (UK, New Zealand, Australia, transitive) To position (something), to align relative to a given position.
examples: Try to orientate your students towards the science subjects.

entries.meaning: (archaic) To move or turn toward the east; to veer from the north or south toward the east.
